byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and PATRICK McGEEHAN

abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio vows that communication and coordination between his administration and that of New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo as they prepare for upcoming winter storm will be better than in 2015, when lack of coordination created political friction.
lead_paragraph: With up to a foot of snow expected to fall on Saturday, Mayor Bill de Blasio urged New Yorkers to stay home and said he expected the subways to stay open.

headline.main: De Blasio Vows Better Coordination as New York Prepares for Snowstorm
headline.print_headline: De Blasio Promises Better Coordination as Region Prepares for Snowstorm

snippet: With up to a foot of snow expected to fall on Saturday, Mayor Bill de Blasio urged New Yorkers to stay home and said he expected the subways to stay open.
